cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.current_location: about 420 mi (675 km) southwest of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northeast across the southeast Gulf of Mexico, forecast to cross south-central Florida on Saturday then continue into the western Atlantic toward the vicinity of Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Florida Peninsula (near Naples to Fort Myers area)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cuban provinces of Matanzas and Isle of Youth (no U.S. east-coast watch in effect)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida east coast south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge (includes Palm Beach County), Florida Keys including the Dry Tortugas, Florida Bay, west coast of Florida south of Middle of Longboat Key to Card Sound Bridge, Lake Okeechobee, Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio/Artemisa/La Habana/Mayabeque, north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire south and central Florida Peninsula including both Gulf and Atlantic coasts, Keys, and north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) likely Saturday, peaking around midday–afternoon as center passes south of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible; guidance indicates 1–2 ft above normal tides for southeast Florida coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches expected across South Florida with isolated totals to 12 inches; considerable urban/flash flooding possible around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Friday night through Saturday across South Florida including Palm Beach County.
